payload.instructions:
# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
Source code lives in `src`. Routes and layouts use the App Router under `src/app`, with segment folders like `src/app/[lineId]` for dynamic pages and `src/app/api` for server handlers. Reusable UI sits in `src/components`, while feature-specific logic is grouped inside `src/features/<feature>`. Shared hooks (`src/hooks`), database helpers (`src/lib`), and design tokens (`src/styles`) keep cross-cutting concerns centralized. Static assets (logos, favicons) belong in `public`. Keep new modules aligned with this layout so imports remain predictable.

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `npm run dev`: Launches the Next.js dev server with React Fast Refresh.
- `npm run build`: Produces an optimized production bundle; run before deploys.
- `npm run start`: Serves the latest build locally for smoke-testing production output.
- `npm run lint`: Executes the project-wide ESLint rules (Next.js core-web-vitals baseline). Treat warnings as errors before opening a PR.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
Use modern ES modules with functional React components. Prefer two-space indentation and trailing commas, matching the existing files. Components that render UI should use PascalCase filenames (`ThemeToggle.jsx`), hooks use camelCase prefixed with `use` (`use-mobile.js`), and utility modules go in `src/lib` with hyphenated names. Favor Tailwind classes for styling; co-locate any component-specific CSS in `src/styles` only if a utility class will not suffice. Run `npm run lint` to ensure ESLint (configured in `eslint.config.mjs`) flags accessibility and performance regressions early.

## Testing Guidelines
Automated tests are not yet wired in. When adding them, group specs beside their feature (`src/features/navigation/__tests__/NavMenu.test.jsx`) so intent is obvious. Name files with `.test.jsx` or `.test.js`. For critical flows lacking automation, document manual verification steps in the PR description and exercise them against `npm run start` output. Keep database interactions mocked or pointed at disposable fixtures to avoid mutating shared environments.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
Craft commit subjects in the imperative mood (“Add navigation badges”), roughly 50 characters, with optional detail in the body. Combine related changes rather than batching multiple features. Pull requests should include: a concise summary, linked issue IDs, screenshots or clip recordings for UI changes, and notes on testing performed (`npm run lint`, manual checks, etc.). Request reviews from owners of affected areas (`src/features/<feature>` or shared libs) before merging.

## Environment & Configuration Tips
Local MySQL connectivity is managed via `src/lib/db.js`, which reads `DB_HOST`, `DB_PORT`, `DB_USER`, `DB_PASSWORD`, and `DB_NAME`. Place secrets in `.env.local`; never commit credentials. Tailwind configuration is defined through `components.json` and `postcss.config.mjs`. If you introduce new design tokens, update `src/styles/tokens.css` and keep class names consistent with Tailwind’s utility-first approach.

content.text:
# AGENTS.md instructions for /home/pjw75/tailwind

<INSTRUCTIONS>
# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
Source code lives in `src`. Routes and layouts use the App Router under `src/app`, with segment folders like `src/app/[lineId]` for dynamic pages and `src/app/api` for server handlers. Reusable UI sits in `src/components`, while feature-specific logic is grouped inside `src/features/<feature>`. Shared hooks (`src/hooks`), database helpers (`src/lib`), and design tokens (`src/styles`) keep cross-cutting concerns centralized. Static assets (logos, favicons) belong in `public`. Keep new modules aligned with this layout so imports remain predictable.

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `npm run dev`: Launches the Next.js dev server with React Fast Refresh.
- `npm run build`: Produces an optimized production bundle; run before deploys.
- `npm run start`: Serves the latest build locally for smoke-testing production output.
- `npm run lint`: Executes the project-wide ESLint rules (Next.js core-web-vitals baseline). Treat warnings as errors before opening a PR.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
Use modern ES modules with functional React components. Prefer two-space indentation and trailing commas, matching the existing files. Components that render UI should use PascalCase filenames (`ThemeToggle.jsx`), hooks use camelCase prefixed with `use` (`use-mobile.js`), and utility modules go in `src/lib` with hyphenated names. Favor Tailwind classes for styling; co-locate any component-specific CSS in `src/styles` only if a utility class will not suffice. Run `npm run lint` to ensure ESLint (configured in `eslint.config.mjs`) flags accessibility and performance regressions early.

## Testing Guidelines
Automated tests are not yet wired in. When adding them, group specs beside their feature (`src/features/navigation/__tests__/NavMenu.test.jsx`) so intent is obvious. Name files with `.test.jsx` or `.test.js`. For critical flows lacking automation, document manual verification steps in the PR description and exercise them against `npm run start` output. Keep database interactions mocked or pointed at disposable fixtures to avoid mutating shared environments.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
Craft commit subjects in the imperative mood (“Add navigation badges”), roughly 50 characters, with optional detail in the body. Combine related changes rather than batching multiple features. Pull requests should include: a concise summary, linked issue IDs, screenshots or clip recordings for UI changes, and notes on testing performed (`npm run lint`, manual checks, etc.). Request reviews from owners of affected areas (`src/features/<feature>` or shared libs) before merging.

## Environment & Configuration Tips
Local MySQL connectivity is managed via `src/lib/db.js`, which reads `DB_HOST`, `DB_PORT`, `DB_USER`, `DB_PASSWORD`, and `DB_NAME`. Place secrets in `.env.local`; never commit credentials. Tailwind configuration is defined through `components.json` and `postcss.config.mjs`. If you introduce new design tokens, update `src/styles/tokens.css` and keep class names consistent with Tailwind’s utility-first approach.

</INSTRUCTIONS>

payload.text:
**Analyzing git rm --cached effects on .codex files**

I’m puzzling through why `.codex/history.jsonl` remains tracked despite `.gitignore` ignoring `.codex/` and running `git rm --cached -r .codex`. It looks like deletions were staged (showing D in `git status`), but since no commit happened, the staging might have cleared or changed due to other actions. I’m trying to understand how `.gitignore` and staging interact here and figuring out the best steps to fully untrack `.codex` files without accidentally re-adding them.

summary.text:
**Analyzing git rm --cached effects on .codex files**

I’m puzzling through why `.codex/history.jsonl` remains tracked despite `.gitignore` ignoring `.codex/` and running `git rm --cached -r .codex`. It looks like deletions were staged (showing D in `git status`), but since no commit happened, the staging might have cleared or changed due to other actions. I’m trying to understand how `.gitignore` and staging interact here and figuring out the best steps to fully untrack `.codex` files without accidentally re-adding them.

**Summarizing final changes**

I'll briefly explain the main code updates including moving the range label to a legend's small text, extending the slider width, and maintaining consistent height. I'll mention the relevant files with inline code and note that some `.codex` deletions remain staged but were not changed here. I'll also recommend natural next steps like running lint and visual checks, while noting tests haven't been run yet.

payload.message:
- Moved the recent-hours summary into the legend as a small caption (`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/filters/QuickFilters.jsx`), so “조회: -36h ~ 현재” sits next to the title.
- Kept the slider row slim by removing the extra inline summary and lengthened the slider container (`w-72`/`sm:w-80`) for easier adjustment.

Tests not run. Consider visually checking the quick filters and running `npm run lint`.

payload.text:
**Reviewing .codex folder git tracking**

I'm analyzing the current git status around the .codex folder to understand why some history files remain tracked despite attempts to remove them and add to .gitignore. It looks like previous `git rm --cached -r .codex` commands staged deletions that weren't committed, and now `.codex/history.jsonl` shows as modified instead of deleted. To fully ignore the folder as requested, I think I should rerun `git rm --cached -r .codex` to restage the removals without affecting user changes, ensuring .codex contents are truly untracked going forward.

summary.text:
**Reviewing .codex folder git tracking**

I'm analyzing the current git status around the .codex folder to understand why some history files remain tracked despite attempts to remove them and add to .gitignore. It looks like previous `git rm --cached -r .codex` commands staged deletions that weren't committed, and now `.codex/history.jsonl` shows as modified instead of deleted. To fully ignore the folder as requested, I think I should rerun `git rm --cached -r .codex` to restage the removals without affecting user changes, ensuring .codex contents are truly untracked going forward.

payload.text:
**Composing final summary message**

I'll recap the key modifications like the ellipsis tooltip for truncated strings/numbers, skipping it for process_flow, repositioning range text from prior steps, and staging removal of .codex. I'll trim test instructions and outline next steps, making sure the user has clear verification guidance and details on new per-cell titles.

payload.message:
- Table cells now ellipsize overflow and show full text on hover via `title` for string/number values; `process_flow` stays untruncated and uses word wrapping (`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/DataTable.jsx`).
- Staged `.codex` directory removals again so it remains ignored; recent-hours quick filter changes remain staged (`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/filters/QuickFilters.jsx`).

Tests not run. Next steps: 1) Visual check that non-`process_flow` cells show `...` and tooltip appears on hover. 2) Run `npm run lint` if desired.

summary.text:
**Composing final summary message**

I'll recap the key modifications like the ellipsis tooltip for truncated strings/numbers, skipping it for process_flow, repositioning range text from prior steps, and staging removal of .codex. I'll trim test instructions and outline next steps, making sure the user has clear verification guidance and details on new per-cell titles.

content.text:
- Table cells now ellipsize overflow and show full text on hover via `title` for string/number values; `process_flow` stays untruncated and uses word wrapping (`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/DataTable.jsx`).
- Staged `.codex` directory removals again so it remains ignored; recent-hours quick filter changes remain staged (`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/filters/QuickFilters.jsx`).

Tests not run. Next steps: 1) Visual check that non-`process_flow` cells show `...` and tooltip appears on hover. 2) Run `npm run lint` if desired.

# ============================================================================== 
# Next.js 개발 환경 변수
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# docker-compose.dev.yml 의 web 서비스에서 사용합니다.
# - 파일 시스템 감지(polling)와 React Fast Refresh 를 위한 개발 설정
# - HTTP 로컬 프록시(nginx default.conf) 전제
# - FastAPI 더미 ADFS 와 Django 개발 서버에 직접 연결
# ============================================================================== 

# --- Build/runtime toggles ----------------------------------------------------
NODE_ENV=development
NPM_CONFIG_PRODUCTION=false
NEXT_TELEMETRY_DISABLED=1
# Docker for Mac/WSL 환경에서 폴링 방식으로 변경해 파일 변경 감지 안정화
CHOKIDAR_USEPOLLING=true
WATCHPACK_POLLING=true

# --- Auth metadata -----------------------------------------------------------
# NextAuth 콜백 URL. 개발 리버스 프록시(http://localhost)를 기준으로 설정합니다.
NEXTAUTH_URL=http://localhost
NEXTAUTH_SECRET=please-change-me

# --- API endpoint wiring -----------------------------------------------------
# 브라우저는 nginx 를 경유하여 /api 로 프록시되고, 서버사이드 요청은 컨테이너 DNS 사용
NEXT_PUBLIC_BACKEND_URL=/api
BACKEND_API_URL=http://api:8000

# --- Airflow integration -----------------------------------------------------
# Airflow 컨테이너는 shared-net 에서 airflow-webserver 라는 서비스명으로 노출됩니다.
# 브라우저 링크는 호스트의 8080 포트를 바라보도록 분리합니다.
AIRFLOW_BASE_URL=http://airflow-webserver:8080
NEXT_PUBLIC_AIRFLOW_BASE_URL=http://localhost:8080
AIRFLOW_USERNAME=airflow
AIRFLOW_PASSWORD=airflow

Exit code: 0
Wall time: 0 seconds
Output:
# ============================================================================== 
# Next.js 운영 환경 변수
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# docker-compose.yml 의 web 서비스에서 사용합니다.
# - 정적 빌드 결과를 제공하며 코드 변경은 재배포 시 반영
# - HTTPS 종단(Nginx inner.conf.backup) 기준으로 서비스 도메인을 지정
# ============================================================================== 

# --- Build/runtime toggles ----------------------------------------------------
NODE_ENV=production

# --- Auth metadata -----------------------------------------------------------
# 운영 도메인(https)을 기준으로 NextAuth 콜백 URL 을 지정하세요.
NEXTAUTH_URL=https://example.com
# 배포 전에 안전한 랜덤 값으로 교체 필수
NEXTAUTH_SECRET=please-change-me

# --- API endpoint wiring -----------------------------------------------------
# 브라우저는 nginx 를 경유하여 /api 로 호출, 서버사이드 요청은 내부 네트워크 주소 사용
NEXT_PUBLIC_BACKEND_URL=/api
BACKEND_API_URL=http://api:8000

# --- Airflow integration -----------------------------------------------------
# 내부 호출은 Docker 네트워크의 서비스명을 사용하고, 외부 링크는 운영 Airflow 도메인으로 교체하세요.
AIRFLOW_BASE_URL=http://airflow-webserver:8080
NEXT_PUBLIC_AIRFLOW_BASE_URL=https://airflow.example.com
AIRFLOW_USERNAME=airflow
AIRFLOW_PASSWORD=airflow

# ============================================================================== 
# Django 개발 환경 전용 Override
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# docker-compose.dev.yml 에서 api.common.env 다음에 로드됩니다.
# - FastAPI 기반 더미 ADFS 서버 연동
# - 코드 변경 사항을 runserver 핫리로드로 즉시 반영
# - HTTP 로컬 리버스 프록시(default.conf) 전제
# ============================================================================== 

# --- Runtime metadata --------------------------------------------------------
ENVIRONMENT=development
DJANGO_SECRET_KEY=local-dev-secret
DJANGO_DEBUG=1
DJANGO_ALLOWED_HOSTS=localhost,127.0.0.1,api

# --- Frontend ↔ Backend URL --------------------------------------------------
# 개발용 Nginx :80 에서 / (Next.js) 와 /api (Django)를 동시에 노출
FRONTEND_BASE_URL=http://localhost
DJANGO_CORS_ALLOWED_ORIGINS=http://localhost
DJANGO_CSRF_TRUSTED_ORIGINS=http://localhost
PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL=/api

# --- Security toggles --------------------------------------------------------
# 로컬 개발 시 HTTPS 관련 강제 옵션을 모두 해제합니다.
DJANGO_SECURE=0
SECURE_SSL_REDIRECT=0
SECURE_HSTS_SECONDS=0
SECURE_HSTS_INCLUDE_SUBDOMAINS=0
SECURE_HSTS_PRELOAD=0

# --- Dummy ADFS (FastAPI) ----------------------------------------------------
# docker-compose.dev 의 adfs 서비스(포트 9000)를 기준으로 설정
OIDC_CLIENT_ID=dummy-client
OIDC_ISSUER=http://localhost:9000/adfs
ADFS_AUTH_URL=http://localhost:9000/authorize
ADFS_LOGOUT_URL=http://localhost:9000/logout
OIDC_REDIRECT_URI=http://localhost/api/auth/google/callback/
ADFS_CER_PATH=/app/dummy_adfs_public.cer
ALLOWED_REDIRECT_HOSTS=appleds.net,appleds.net:8003

Exit code: 0

services:
  api:
    build:
      context: ./apps/api
    env_file:
      - ./env/api.common.env
      - ./env/api.dev.env
    depends_on:
      - adfs
    volumes:
      - ./apps/api:/app
      - api_data:/data
      - api_static:/app/staticfiles
    ports:
      - "8000:8000"
    entrypoint:
      - /bin/sh
      - -c
      - |
          set -e
          python manage.py migrate --noinput
          python manage.py runserver 0.0.0.0:8000
    networks:
      shared-net:
        aliases:
          - api

  web:
    build:
      context: ./apps/web
    env_file:
      - ./env/web.dev.env
    depends_on:
      - api
    command: sh -c "npm install && npm run dev -- --host 0.0.0.0 --port 3000"
    volumes:
      - ./apps/web:/app
      - web_node_modules:/app/node_modules
    ports:
      - "3000:3000"
    networks:
      shared-net:
        aliases:
          - web

  adfs:
    build:
      context: ./apps/adfs_dummy
    environment:
      DUMMY_ADFS_EMAIL: dummy.user@example.com
      DUMMY_ADFS_NAME: Dummy User
      DUMMY_ADFS_CLIENT_ID: dummy-client
      DUMMY_ADFS_PRIVATE_KEY_PATH: /app/dummy_adfs_private.key
      # 개발 환경에서는 더미 ADFS 서버가 HTTP로 구동되므로 issuer 도 동일하게 맞춘다
      DUMMY_ADFS_ISSUER: http://localhost:9000/adfs
    ports:
      - "9000:9000"
    networks:
      shared-net:
        aliases:
          - adfs

  nginx:
    image: nginx:1.27-alpine
    depends_on:
      - web
      - api
    ports:
      - "80:80"
    volumes:
      - ./deploy/nginx/default.conf:/etc/nginx/conf.d/default.conf:ro
      - api_static:/var/www/static:ro
    networks:
      - shared-net

volumes:
  api_data:
  api_static:
  web_node_modules:

networks:
  shared-net:
    external: true
    name: shared-net

Exit code: 0
Wall time: 0 seconds

      dockerfile: Dockerfile

      - ./env/api.prod.env

  web:

Output:
# ============================================================================== 
# Django 공통 환경 변수 템플릿
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
# docker-compose(dev/prod) 모두에서 가장 먼저 불러오는 기본 설정입니다.
# 운영 비밀 값은 실제 배포 시 외부 Secret Manager 또는 Override 파일로 교체하세요.
# ============================================================================== 

# --- Core metadata ------------------------------------------------------------
# 애플리케이션에서 기본적으로 사용할 타임존
DJANGO_TIME_ZONE=UTC

# --- Database connection ------------------------------------------------------
# Django ORM이 사용할 PostgreSQL 접속 정보 (서비스/배포 환경에 맞게 조정)
DJANGO_DB_ENGINE=django.db.backends.postgresql
DJANGO_DB_NAME=appdb
DJANGO_DB_USER=airflow
DJANGO_DB_PASSWORD=airflow
DJANGO_DB_HOST=airflow-postgres
DJANGO_DB_PORT=5432
# 장기 연결 유지 시간(초). 운영 환경에서는 DB 정책에 맞춰 조정하세요.
DJANGO_DB_CONN_MAX_AGE=60

# --- Authentication redirect targets -----------------------------------------
# 로그인/로그아웃 이후 이동할 기본 경로
DJANGO_LOGIN_REDIRECT_URL=/
DJANGO_LOGOUT_REDIRECT_URL=/

# --- Reverse proxy awareness --------------------------------------------------
# Nginx 같은 프록시 뒤에서 동작할 때 필요한 Django 보안 헤더 플래그
USE_X_FORWARDED_HOST=1
DJANGO_USE_PROXY_SSL_HEADER=1
SECURE_REFERRER_POLICY=same-origin

# --- Public API exposure ------------------------------------------------------
# 외부에서 접근할 때 사용할 API 베이스 경로 (프록시에서 /api 로 라우팅)
PUBLIC_API_BASE_URL=

# --- OIDC / ADFS provider defaults -------------------------------------------
# 실제 IdP(Azure AD / 사내 ADFS 등) 정보를 환경별 override 파일에서 설정합니다.
OIDC_CLIENT_ID=
OIDC_ISSUER=
ADFS_AUTH_URL=
ADFS_LOGOUT_URL=
OIDC_REDIRECT_URI=
ADFS_CER_PATH=
ALLOWED_REDIRECT_HOSTS=appleds.net,appleds.net:8003

# --- Gunicorn runtime defaults ------------------------------------------------
# 운영 컨테이너에서 사용되는 기본 워커/스레드 수 (필요 시 override)
GUNICORN_WORKERS=3
GUNICORN_THREADS=2

payload.text:
**Configuring Airflow environment URLs**

I’m thinking through how to set Airflow’s base URLs consistently, leaning toward using `/airflow` to match the Nginx proxy path instead of external domains, while cleaning up unused Next.js settings like NextAuth to slim down files and update comments accordingly. I’ll make sure to manage git staging carefully to avoid re-adding `.codex` files that were removed earlier.

summary.text:
**Configuring Airflow environment URLs**

I’m thinking through how to set Airflow’s base URLs consistently, leaning toward using `/airflow` to match the Nginx proxy path instead of external domains, while cleaning up unused Next.js settings like NextAuth to slim down files and update comments accordingly. I’ll make sure to manage git staging carefully to avoid re-adding `.codex` files that were removed earlier.

payload.name: apply_patch
payload.input:
*** Begin Patch
*** Update File: env/web.dev.env
@@
-# ============================================================================== 
-# Next.js 개발 환경 변수
-# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-# docker-compose.dev.yml 의 web 서비스에서 사용합니다.
-# - 파일 시스템 감지(polling)와 React Fast Refresh 를 위한 개발 설정
-# - HTTP 로컬 프록시(nginx default.conf) 전제
-# - FastAPI 더미 ADFS 와 Django 개발 서버에 직접 연결
-# ============================================================================== 
-
-# --- Build/runtime toggles ----------------------------------------------------
-NODE_ENV=development
-NPM_CONFIG_PRODUCTION=false
-NEXT_TELEMETRY_DISABLED=1
-# Docker for Mac/WSL 환경에서 폴링 방식으로 변경해 파일 변경 감지 안정화
-CHOKIDAR_USEPOLLING=true
-WATCHPACK_POLLING=true
-
-# --- Auth metadata -----------------------------------------------------------
-# NextAuth 콜백 URL. 개발 리버스 프록시(http://localhost)를 기준으로 설정합니다.
-NEXTAUTH_URL=http://localhost
-NEXTAUTH_SECRET=please-change-me
-
-# --- API endpoint wiring -----------------------------------------------------
-# 브라우저는 nginx 를 경유하여 /api 로 프록시되고, 서버사이드 요청은 컨테이너 DNS 사용
-NEXT_PUBLIC_BACKEND_URL=/api
-BACKEND_API_URL=http://api:8000
-
-# --- Airflow integration -----------------------------------------------------
-# Airflow 컨테이너는 shared-net 에서 airflow-webserver 라는 서비스명으로 노출됩니다.
-# 브라우저 링크는 호스트의 8080 포트를 바라보도록 분리합니다.
-AIRFLOW_BASE_URL=http://airflow-webserver:8080
-NEXT_PUBLIC_AIRFLOW_BASE_URL=http://localhost:8080
-AIRFLOW_USERNAME=airflow
-AIRFLOW_PASSWORD=airflow
+# ==============================================================================
+# Vite 웹 개발 환경 변수
+# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+# docker-compose.dev.yml 의 web 서비스에서 사용합니다.
+# - React Fast Refresh 와 파일 변경 감지 안정화를 위한 개발 설정
+# - nginx 프록시(default.conf) 기준으로 API/Airflow 연결
+# ==============================================================================
+
+# --- Build/runtime toggles ----------------------------------------------------
+NODE_ENV=development
+NPM_CONFIG_PRODUCTION=false
+# Docker for Mac/WSL 환경에서 폴링 방식으로 변경해 파일 변경 감지 안정화
+CHOKIDAR_USEPOLLING=true
+WATCHPACK_POLLING=true
+
+# --- API endpoint wiring -----------------------------------------------------
+# Vite 클라이언트에서 사용할 백엔드 API 베이스 URL
+VITE_BACKEND_URL=http://localhost:8000
+# 컨테이너 간 내부 통신용 백엔드 주소
+BACKEND_API_URL=http://api:8000
+
+# --- Airflow integration -----------------------------------------------------
+# 내부 호출은 Docker 네트워크의 서비스명을 사용, 브라우저는 호스트 포트를 봅니다.
+AIRFLOW_BASE_URL=http://airflow-webserver:8080
+VITE_AIRFLOW_BASE_URL=http://localhost:8080
+AIRFLOW_USERNAME=airflow
+AIRFLOW_PASSWORD=airflow
*** End Patch

payload.output: {"output":"Success. Updated the following files:\nM env/web.dev.env\n","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}

*** Update File: env/web.prod.env
@@
-# ============================================================================== 
-# Next.js 운영 환경 변수
-# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-# docker-compose.yml 의 web 서비스에서 사용합니다.
-# - 정적 빌드 결과를 제공하며 코드 변경은 재배포 시 반영
-# - HTTPS 종단(Nginx inner.conf.backup) 기준으로 서비스 도메인을 지정
-# ============================================================================== 
-
-# --- Build/runtime toggles ----------------------------------------------------
-NODE_ENV=production
-
-# --- Auth metadata -----------------------------------------------------------
-# 운영 도메인(https)을 기준으로 NextAuth 콜백 URL 을 지정하세요.
-NEXTAUTH_URL=https://example.com
-# 배포 전에 안전한 랜덤 값으로 교체 필수
-NEXTAUTH_SECRET=please-change-me
-
-# --- API endpoint wiring -----------------------------------------------------
-# 브라우저는 nginx 를 경유하여 /api 로 호출, 서버사이드 요청은 내부 네트워크 주소 사용
-NEXT_PUBLIC_BACKEND_URL=/api
-BACKEND_API_URL=http://api:8000
-
-# --- Airflow integration -----------------------------------------------------
-# 내부 호출은 Docker 네트워크의 서비스명을 사용하고, 외부 링크는 운영 Airflow 도메인으로 교체하세요.
-AIRFLOW_BASE_URL=http://airflow-webserver:8080
-NEXT_PUBLIC_AIRFLOW_BASE_URL=https://airflow.example.com
-AIRFLOW_USERNAME=airflow
-AIRFLOW_PASSWORD=airflow
+# ==============================================================================
+# Vite 웹 운영 환경 변수
+# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+# docker-compose.yml 의 web 서비스에서 사용합니다.
+# - 정적 빌드 결과를 제공하며 코드 변경은 재배포 시 반영
+# - nginx 프록시(default.conf) 기준으로 API/Airflow 연결
+# ==============================================================================
+
+# --- Build/runtime toggles ----------------------------------------------------
+NODE_ENV=production
+
+# --- API endpoint wiring -----------------------------------------------------
+# 브라우저는 nginx 를 경유하여 /api 로 호출, 컨테이너 내부 요청은 서비스명 사용
+VITE_BACKEND_URL=/api
+BACKEND_API_URL=http://api:8000
+
+# --- Airflow integration -----------------------------------------------------
+# 내부 호출은 Docker 네트워크의 서비스명을 사용하고, 외부 접근 경로는 필요에 따라 교체하세요.
+AIRFLOW_BASE_URL=http://airflow-webserver:8080
+VITE_AIRFLOW_BASE_URL=/airflow
+AIRFLOW_USERNAME=airflow
+AIRFLOW_PASSWORD=airflow
*** End Patch

payload.text:
**Summarizing environment cleanup changes**

I’m putting together a concise final message explaining the removal of Next.js–specific environment variables and fallback code, switching to Vite-style env naming, and updating related API helpers. I’ll include key file paths changed, note tests weren’t run, and suggest sensible next steps like verifying env URLs and running a dev build, keeping the explanation clear and friendly.

payload.message:
- Cleaned web env files to remove Next-specific settings and switch to Vite-friendly variables (`env/web.dev.env`, `env/web.prod.env`), keeping only backend/Airflow values needed now.
- Updated the API dev env comment to reference the frontend generically instead of Next (`env/api.dev.env`).
- Removed unused Next env fallbacks from runtime helpers so only Vite/generic keys are read (`apps/web/src/lib/api.js`, `apps/web/src/features/airflow/api/get-airflow-dag-overview.js`).

Tests not run. Next steps: set the new `VITE_*` values to your actual backend/Airflow endpoints and run `npm run dev`/`npm run build` to confirm everything still resolves correctly.

summary.text:
**Summarizing environment cleanup changes**

I’m putting together a concise final message explaining the removal of Next.js–specific environment variables and fallback code, switching to Vite-style env naming, and updating related API helpers. I’ll include key file paths changed, note tests weren’t run, and suggest sensible next steps like verifying env URLs and running a dev build, keeping the explanation clear and friendly.

content.text:
- Cleaned web env files to remove Next-specific settings and switch to Vite-friendly variables (`env/web.dev.env`, `env/web.prod.env`), keeping only backend/Airflow values needed now.
- Updated the API dev env comment to reference the frontend generically instead of Next (`env/api.dev.env`).
- Removed unused Next env fallbacks from runtime helpers so only Vite/generic keys are read (`apps/web/src/lib/api.js`, `apps/web/src/features/airflow/api/get-airflow-dag-overview.js`).

Tests not run. Next steps: set the new `VITE_*` values to your actual backend/Airflow endpoints and run `npm run dev`/`npm run build` to confirm everything still resolves correctly.
